intro: Oxytropis terrae-novae, commonly known as the Terra Nova locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Newfoundland and Labrador. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces small, bean-shaped pods that contain several seeds, and it thrives in sandy, well-drained soils. Oxytropis terrae-novae is adapted to the harsh maritime climate, with its growth cycle synchronized with the seasonal patterns of its coastal habitat.
